page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: A secondary school pupil writes: I use the 146 bus from Keston to Hayes. This single-decker bus runs from Downe to Bromley North station. Routes 119 and 138 which also run through Hayes are served by double-deckers, the 138 has recently returned to a double-decker. The 119 was until recently an open-backed bus with a conductor who collected the fares. The new buses have two doors, the passengers get on at the front,pay the driver and get off at the centre doors. The 146 runs infrequently as there are not many passengers. A private company is to start operating the service soon. There are few taxis in this area as the public transport is good enough and many own cars. Hayes people use three rail stations: Hayes, West Wickham and Bromley South.
